  • A common trend we see is that data professionals are more likely to leverage these resources - even when only comparing individuals in the same age group.
  • When considering online platforms we see that Coursera has cemented its place in our #1 spot. In the next few spots Udemy, Kaggle Learning courses and Data Camp are also popular among the two groups.
  • While University Courses do often pop up in the top 5 of our list, we see that less than 30% of all data professionals have completed a data science course in university. This goes to show that having a degree in data science isn't always necessary to work in this field.

3.9 Media and learning
¶

The field of data science and machine learning is advancing at a rapid rate. Let's look at some of the tools that will help you to continuously learn and keep in touch with the latest in your field.

Source: Kaggle 2020 DS and ML Survey - Q39. Who/what are your favorite media sources that report on data science topics?

# Getting questions
q39 = [question for question in questions if 'Q39' in question]

media = []
for qn in q39:
    for val in dataprofs[qn].unique():
        media.append(val)
        
media = [str.strip(medium).split(" (")[0] for medium in media if str(medium)!='nan']

media_counts = dataprofs[q39].notnull().sum()

media_students_counts.index = media

media_student_percentages = media_students_counts / students.shape[0]

        xref = "paper",
        yref = "paper",
        text= main_annot_format % ("PROFESSIONALS LEARN MORE",
                                   text2),
        ax=0, ay=0
))

fig.add_annotation(dict(
        x=0.775,
        y=0.17,
        xref = "paper",
        yref = "paper",
        text= main_annot_format % ("BLOGS",
                                   text3),
        ax=0, ay=0
))

iplot(fig)

# Quick one, ~2hr on this graph

Using media is a great way to catch up on trends and updates in our field. They provide information in a more entertaining and informal manner that one can always pick up at their own convenience, making them a great way to supplement our more structured learning activities. On seeing the trend that professionals seem to utilise more of these, perhaps students might want to look into a couple ML/DS related content creators on their favorite platforms.

Other notable sources that didn't quite make the top 5 here are - email newsletters, podcasts, slack communities, reddit, etc.

3.10 Obstacles to working with data
¶

While studying in preparation for working with data we tend to live in this bubble of ours, assuming that things will work out since we probably are qualified enough to work in our field of choice. We often neglect actually getting a sense of how the job market is and what are the struggles faced by those actively hunting for work in the same field.

To get an idea of the trappings that prevent students from landing that dream data role, we look at Ananconda's report where they asked students what was the biggest factor that prevented them from securing their ideal data science job.

Source: Anaconda's State of DS Report 2020 - In your opinion, what is the biggest obstacle to obtaining your ideal data science job?
In [25]:
# Defining the data from Anaconda's report
problems_labels = ["Experience", "Technical skills", "Soft skills", "Finding a job<br>that gives me a<br>sense of purpose","Finding a job<br>that pays enough","Limited job openings"]
problems_percentages = np.float32([.40,.26,.18,.07,.04,.02])

trace = go.Bar(
    y = problems_percentages,
    x = problems_labels,
    marker = dict(color = [primary_blue]+[primary_grey]*5),
    text = [str(text)+" %" for text in np.int32(problems_percentages*100)],
    textfont = dict(size = 15),
    textposition = "outside",
    width = 0.95
)

layout = dict(
    margin = dict(t=20,b=0, pad=5),
    yaxis=dict(
            showticklabels = False,
            zeroline=True,
            zerolinewidth=1,
            zerolinecolor="#4d4d4d",
            ),
    xaxis = dict(
            tickangle = 0,
            tickfont = dict(family="Tahoma",size=11),
            
            ),
    width = 750,
    height= 450,
    plot_bgcolor = "#fff"
)

large_title_format = "<span style='font-size:32px; font-family:Times New Roman;'>Biggest obstacle to obtaining your<br><br>ideal data science job?</span>"
small_title_format = "<span style='font-size:13px; font-family:Helvetica'>  Rather than limited job opportunities, most students responded<br>      that their main reason for not landing their ideal job was their<br><b style='color:#496595'>lack of experience and technical ability.</b>      </span>"

fig = go.Figure(data = trace, layout = layout)

# title annotation
fig.add_annotation(dict(
                            x=3.0,
                            y=0.33,
                            showarrow=False,
                            text= large_title_format + "<br><br>" + small_title_format,
                            textangle=0,
                            xref="x",
                            yref="y"
                           ))

iplot(fig)

I initially expected that a lack of job openings would be a major factor, but turns out that this was hardly the case. Most students claimed that their reason for not securing their ideal job was that they lacked the experience for it. Often this will be due to companies asking for "x years of experience in..." which will turn away most students early in their careers, otherwise it might be experience working in a particular field or with specific tools.
While there may be no direct workaround for this, seeking internships in a related area of work would go a long way as initial work experience. Data science side-projects are also a great way to showcase your ability, so long as the content is novel and well-thought out.

4. So you want to work in..?
¶

In this section I'll be going over some of the different areas of machine learning, namely - Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and machine learning for analytics in general. Each domain has its own specialists and methods specific to them and I will briefly try to shed some light on these fields.

4.1 Computer Vision
¶

In computer vision the main aim is to help machines develop a higher understanding of image or video data. In essence it seeks to automate (or improve) any task which otherwise relies on human vision.

Source: Kaggle 2020 DS and ML Survey
In [26]:
q18  = [question for question in questions if "Q18" in question]
q18_not_none = q18[:5] + [q18[6]]

cv_users = dataprofs[dataprofs[q18_not_none].notnull().sum(axis=1) >=1 ]
cv_fields = cv_users["Q5"].value_counts() / cv_users.shape[0]

# Creating dataframe for computer vision fields 
cv_fields_df = pd.DataFrame()
cv_fields_df["field"] = cv_fields.index[:6]
cv_fields_df["value"] = cv_fields.values[:6] * 100
cv_fields_df["field"].replace(["Machine Learning Engineer"],["ML Engineer"], inplace=True)

cv_fields_df.to_csv("cv_fields.csv", index=False, header=["field","value"])

# Creating dataframe for computer vision tools
cvtools = []
for qn in q18:
    for val in dataprofs[qn].unique():
        cvtools.append(val)
        
cvtools = [str.strip(cvtool) for cvtool in cvtools if str(cvtool)!='nan']
cvtools[3] = "General purpose networks (VGG, Inception, ResNet, etc.)"
cvtools_counts = cv_users[q18].count()

cvtools_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=["name","value"])
cvtools_df["name"] = cvtools[:5] + [cvtools[6]]
cvtools_df["value"] = cvtools_counts.drop(["Q18_Part_6"]).values

cvtools_df.to_csv("cv_tools.csv", index=False, header=["name","value"])

         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://d3js.org/d3.v4.min"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
        
        // set the dimensions and margins of the graph
        var margin = {top: 40, right: 20, bottom: 40, left: 98},
            width = 350 - margin.left - margin.right,
            height = 340 - margin.top - margin.bottom;
        
        // append the svg_fields object to the body of the page
        var svg_fields = d3.select("#cv_fields")
          .append("svg")
            .attr("width", width + margin.left + margin.right)
            .attr("height", height + margin.top + margin.bottom)
          .append("g")
            .attr("transform",
                  "translate(" + margin.left + "," + margin.top + ")");

        svg_fields.append("text")
            .text("Percentage of Computer Vision users")
            .attr("x",-80)
            .attr("y",-15)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "20px")

        // Parse the Data
        d3.csv("cv_fields.csv", function(data) {
        
        var max = d3.max(data, d=> +d.value)
          // Add X axis
          var x = d3.scaleLinear()
            .domain([0, 32])
            .range([ 0, width]);
          svg_fields.append("g")
            .attr("transform", "translate(0," + height + ")")
            .call(d3.axisBottom(x))
            .selectAll("text")
            //   .attr("transform", "translate(-10,0)rotate(-45)")
              .style("text-anchor", "end");
        
            // Y axis
            var y = d3.scaleBand()
                .range([ 0, height ])
                .domain(data.map(function(d) { return d.field; }))
                .padding(.1);
            svg_fields.append("g")
                .call(d3.axisLeft(y))
        
             //Bars
            svg_fields.selectAll("myRect")
                .data(data)
                .enter()
                .append("rect")
                .attr("x", x(0) )
                .attr("y", function(d) { return y(d.field); })
                .attr("width", function(d) { return x(d.value); })
                .attr("height", y.bandwidth() )
                .attr("fill", (d) => { return (+d.value == max? "#3f4d63": "#c6ccd8") } )
        })

        var margin_tools = {top: 40, right: 20, bottom: 40, left: 20},
            width_tools = 350 - margin_tools.left - margin_tools.right,
            height_tools = 340 - margin_tools.top - margin_tools.bottom;

        var svg_tools = d3.select("#cv_tools")
            .append("svg")
                .attr("width", width_tools + margin_tools.left + margin_tools.right)
                .attr("height", height_tools + margin_tools.top + margin_tools.bottom)
            .append("g")
                .attr("transform",
                    "translate(" + margin_tools.left + "," + margin_tools.top + ")");
        
        svg_tools.append("text")
            .text("Most used Computer Vision Methods")
            .attr("x",0)
            .attr("y",-15)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "21px")            

        d3.csv("cv_tools.csv", function(data) {

            data = data.sort((a,b) => d3.descending(+a.value, +b.value))
            var max = d3.max(data, d=> +d.value)
            // Add X axis
            var x = d3.scaleLinear()
                .domain([0, 2200])
                .range([ 0, width_tools]);
                svg_tools.append("g")
                    .attr("transform", "translate(0," + height_tools + ")")
                    .call(d3.axisBottom(x))
                    .selectAll("text")
                        .attr("transform", "translate(-10,0)")
                        .style("text-anchor", "end");


            // Y axis
            var y = d3.scaleBand()
            .range([ 0, height_tools ])
            .domain(data.map(function(d) { return d.name; }))
            .padding(.55);
            svg_tools.append("g")
            .call(d3.axisLeft(y))
                .selectAll("text")
                .attr("text-anchor", "start")

                .style("font-family", "Tahoma")

            //Bars

js_t1 = '''
         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://d3js.org/d3.v4.min"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
        
         var margin_tree = {top: 20, right: 10, bottom: 5, left: 10},
            width_tree = 710 - margin_tree.left - margin_tree.right,
            height_tree = 340 - margin_tree.top - margin_tree.bottom;
        
        // append the svg object to the body of the page
        var svg_tree = d3.selectAll("#cv_tree")
        .append("svg")
            .attr("width", width_tree + margin_tree.left + margin_tree.right)
            .attr("height", height_tree + margin_tree.top + margin_tree.bottom)
        .append("g")
            .attr("transform", "translate(" + margin_tree.left + "," + margin_tree.top + ")");
        
        showData("count")
        document.getElementById("tree_button1").addEventListener("click", function(evt) {showData("count")});
        document.getElementById("tree_button2").addEventListener("click", function(evt) {showData("salary")});

        function showData(mode){
        // Read data
        
        d3.csv('cv_tree.csv', function(data) {
        var max = d3.max(data, (d)=> {return mode =="count"?  +d.value: +d.value2;})
       
        var colorScale1 = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f1efd9","#AF9973","#a2885e"]) //["#a2885e","#f1efd9","#235f83"]
        .domain([40,max/6, max])

        var colorScale2 = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f1efd9","#457791","#235f83"]) //["#a2885e","#f1efd9","#235f83"]
        .domain([5000,max/2, max])

          // stratify the data: reformatting for d3.js
        var root = d3.stratify()
            .id(function(d) { return d.name; })   // Name of the entity (column name is name in csv)
            .parentId(function(d) { return d.parent; })   // Name of the parent (column name is parent in csv)
            (data);
        root.sum(function(d) {return mode =="count"?  +d.value: +d.value2; })   // Compute the numeric value for each entity
        
          // Then d3.treemap computes the position of each element of the hierarchy
          // The coordinates are added to the root object above
        d3.treemap()
            .size([width_tree, height_tree])
            .padding(4)
            (root)

        var u = svg_tree
            .selectAll("rect")
            .data(root.leaves())
            
            u
            .enter()
            .append("rect")
            .merge(u)
            .transition()
            .duration(1000)
            .attr('x', function (d) { return d.x0; })
            .attr('y', function (d) { return d.y0; })
            .attr('width', function (d) { return d.x1 - d.x0; })
            .attr('height', function (d) { return d.y1 - d.y0; })
            .style("stroke", "black")
            .style("fill", (d) => {
                return (mode =="count"?  colorScale1(+d.value): colorScale2(+d.value))
            });
    
        // and to add the text labels
        var v = svg_tree
            .selectAll("text")
            .data(root.leaves())

            v
            .enter()
            .append("text")
            .merge(v)
                .attr("x", function(d){ return d.x0+10})    // +10 to adjust position (more right)
                .attr("y", function(d){ return d.y0+15})    // +20 to adjust position (lower)
                .text(function(d){ return d.data.name})
                .attr("font-size", "15px")
                .attr("fill", "white")
        
        var w = svg_tree
            .selectAll("text.count")
            .data(root.leaves())

            w
            .enter()
            .append("text")
            .merge(w)
                .attr("class", function(d){ return "count "+d.data.name})
                .attr("x", function(d){ return (d.x1+d.x0)/2 })    // +10 to adjust position (more right)
                .attr("y", function(d){ return (d.y1+d.y0)/2 + 15})    // +20 to adjust position (lower)
                .text(function(d){ return mode == "count"? d.data.value: (d.data.value2.replace(/\B(?=(\d{3})+(?!\d))/g, ","));})
                .attr("text-anchor","middle")
                .style("font-size", function(d){ 
                    return mode == "count"? "30px" : "22px";
                })
                .attr("fill", "white")
                .style("font-family", "Arial")
        
        svg_tree
            .append("text")
            .attr("class","title")
            .text("Top Countries and their Salaries")
            .attr("x", 5)
            .attr("y",-5)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "21px")
        })
    }

});
'''

def get_radar_data(dataframe):
    temp = dataframe[q23].count()
    
    #Remove "none" label
    temp.index = labels[:-1]

    temp = temp/dataframe.shape[0]

    l1 = []
    for label in labels[:-1]:
        record = {}
        record["axis"] = label
        record["value"]= temp[label]
        l1.append(record)
    return l1

js_t1 = '''
         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/d3/3.5.5/d3.min.js"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
        
         function RadarChart(id, data, options) {
	var cfg = {
	 w: 600,				//Width of the circle
	 h: 600,				//Height of the circle
	 margin: {top: 20, right: 20, bottom: 20, left: 20}, //The margins of the SVG
	 levels: 3,				//How many levels or inner circles should there be drawn
	 maxValue: 0, 			//What is the value that the biggest circle will represent
	 labelFactor: 1.26, 	//How much farther than the radius of the outer circle should the labels be placed
	 wrapWidth: 60, 		//The number of pixels after which a label needs to be given a new line
	 opacityArea: 0.35, 	//The opacity of the area of the blob
	 dotRadius: 3, 			//The size of the colored circles of each blog
	 opacityCircles: 0.1, 	//The opacity of the circles of each blob
	 strokeWidth: 1, 		//The width of the stroke around each blob
	 roundStrokes: false,	//If true the area and stroke will follow a round path (cardinal-closed)
	 color: d3.scaleOrdinal().range(["#bbb","#496595"])	//Color function
	};
	
	//Put all of the options into a variable called cfg
	if('undefined' !== typeof options){
	  for(var i in options){
		if('undefined' !== typeof options[i]){ cfg[i] = options[i]; }
	  }//for i
	}//if
	
	//If the supplied maxValue is smaller than the actual one, replace by the max in the data
	var maxValue = Math.max(cfg.maxValue, d3.max(data, function(i){return d3.max(i.map(function(o){return o.value;}))}));
		
	var allAxis = (data[0].map(function(i, j){return i.axis})),	//Names of each axis
		total = allAxis.length,					//The number of different axes
		radius = Math.min(cfg.w/2, cfg.h/2), 	//Radius of the outermost circle
		Format = d3.format('.0%'),			 	//Percentage formatting
		angleSlice = Math.PI * 2 / total;		//The width in radians of each "slice"
	
	//Scale for the radius
	var rScale = d3.scaleLinear()
		.range([0, radius])
		.domain([0, maxValue]);
		
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////////// Create the container SVG and g /////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

	//Remove whatever chart with the same id/class was present before
	d3.select(id).select("svg").remove();
	
	//Initiate the radar chart SVG
	var svg = d3.select(id).append("svg")
			.attr("width",  cfg.w + cfg.margin.left + cfg.margin.right)
			.attr("height", cfg.h + cfg.margin.top + cfg.margin.bottom)
			.attr("class", "radar"+id);
	//Append a g element		
	var g = svg.append("g")
			.attr("transform", "translate(" + (cfg.w/2 + cfg.margin.left) + "," + (cfg.h/2 + cfg.margin.top) + ")");
	
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	////////// Glow filter for some extra pizzazz ///////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Filter for the outside glow
	var filter = g.append('defs').append('filter').attr('id','glow'),
		feGaussianBlur = filter.append('feGaussianBlur').attr('stdDeviation','2.5').attr('result','coloredBlur'),
		feMerge = filter.append('feMerge'),
		feMergeNode_1 = feMerge.append('feMergeNode').attr('in','coloredBlur'),
		feMergeNode_2 = feMerge.append('feMergeNode').attr('in','SourceGraphic');

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	/////////////// Draw the Circular grid //////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Wrapper for the grid & axes
	var axisGrid = g.append("g").attr("class", "axisWrapper");
	
	//Draw the background circles
	axisGrid.selectAll(".levels")
	   .data(d3.range(1,(cfg.levels+1)).reverse())
	   .enter()
		.append("circle")
		.attr("class", "gridCircle")
		.attr("r", function(d, i){return radius/cfg.levels*d;})
		.style("fill", "#fff")
		.style("stroke", "#dedede")
		.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityCircles)
		.style("filter" , "url(#glow)");

	//Text indicating at what % each level is
	axisGrid.selectAll(".axisLabel")
	   .data(d3.range(1,(cfg.levels+1)).reverse())
	   .enter().append("text")
	   .attr("class", "axisLabel")
	   .attr("x", 4)
	   .attr("y", function(d){return -d*radius/cfg.levels;})
	   .attr("dy", "0.4em")
	   .style("font-size", "10px")
	   .attr("fill", "#737373")
	   .text(function(d,i) { return Format(maxValue * d/cfg.levels); });

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////////////////// Draw the axes //////////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Create the straight lines radiating outward from the center
	var axis = axisGrid.selectAll(".axis")
		.data(allAxis)
		.enter()
		.append("g")
		.attr("class", "axis");
	//Append the lines
	axis.append("line")
		.attr("x1", 0)
		.attr("y1", 0)
		.attr("x2", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue*1.05) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("y2", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue*1.05) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("class", "line")
		.style("stroke", "#333")
		.style("stroke-width", "1px");

	//Append the labels at each axis
	axis.append("text")
		.attr("class", "legend")
		.style("font-size", "10px")
		.attr("text-anchor", "middle")
		.attr("dy", "-1em")
		.attr("x", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue * cfg.labelFactor) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("y", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue * cfg.labelFactor) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
        .text(function(d){return d})
        .style("font-weight",600)
		.call(wrap, cfg.wrapWidth);

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	///////////// Draw the radar chart blobs ////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//The radial line function
	var radarLine = d3.lineRadial()
		.radius(function(d) { return rScale(d.value); })
		.angle(function(d,i) {	return i*angleSlice; })
        .curve(d3.curveLinearClosed);
		
	if(cfg.roundStrokes) {
		radarLine.interpolate("cardinal-closed");
	}
				
	//Create a wrapper for the blobs	
	var blobWrapper = g.selectAll(".radarWrapper")
		.data(data)
		.enter().append("g")
		.attr("class", "radarWrapper");
			
	//Append the backgrounds	
	blobWrapper
		.append("path")
		.attr("class", "radarArea")
		.attr("d", function(d,i) { return radarLine(d); })
		.style("fill", function(d,i) { return cfg.color(i); })
		.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityArea)
		.on('mouseover', function (d,i){
			//Dim all blobs
			d3.selectAll(".radarArea")
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", 0.1); 
			//Bring back the hovered over blob
			d3.select(this)
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", 0.7);	
		})
		.on('mouseout', function(){
			//Bring back all blobs
			d3.selectAll(".radarArea")
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityArea);
		});
		
	//Create the outlines	
	blobWrapper.append("path")
		.attr("class", "radarStroke")
		.attr("d", function(d,i) { return radarLine(d); })
		.style("stroke-width", cfg.strokeWidth + "px")
		.style("stroke", function(d,i) { return cfg.color(i); })
		.style("fill", "none")
		.style("filter" , "url(#glow)");		
	
	//Append the circles
	blobWrapper.selectAll(".radarCircle")
		.data(function(d,i) { return d; })
		.enter().append("circle")
		.attr("class", "radarCircle")
		.attr("r", cfg.dotRadius)
		.attr("cx", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("cy", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.style("fill", function(d,i,j) { return data[0].map((d)=>d.value).includes(d.value)? cfg.color(0): cfg.color(1); })
		.style("fill-opacity", 0.8);

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////// Append invisible circles for tooltip ///////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Wrapper for the invisible circles on top
	var blobCircleWrapper = g.selectAll(".radarCircleWrapper")
		.data(data)
		.enter().append("g")
		.attr("class", "radarCircleWrapper");
		
	//Append a set of invisible circles on top for the mouseover pop-up
	blobCircleWrapper.selectAll(".radarInvisibleCircle")
		.data(function(d,i) { return d; })
		.enter().append("circle")
		.attr("class", "radarInvisibleCircle")
		.attr("r", cfg.dotRadius*1.5)
		.attr("cx", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("cy", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.style("fill", "none")
		.style("pointer-events", "all")
		.on("mouseover", function(d,i) {
			newX =  parseFloat(d3.select(this).attr('cx')) - 10;
			newY =  parseFloat(d3.select(this).attr('cy')) - 10;
					
			tooltip
				.attr('x', newX)
				.attr('y', newY)
				.text(Format(d.value))
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style('opacity', 1);
		})
		.on("mouseout", function(){
			tooltip.transition().duration(200)
				.style("opacity", 0);
		});
		
	//Set up the small tooltip for when you hover over a circle
	var tooltip = g.append("text")
		.attr("class", "tooltip")
		.style("opacity", 0);
	
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	/////////////////// Helper Function /////////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

	//Taken from http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/7555321
	//Wraps SVG text	
	function wrap(text, width) {
	  text.each(function() {
		var text = d3.select(this),
			words = text.text().split(/\s+/).reverse(),
			word,
			line = [],
			lineNumber = 0,
			lineHeight = 1.4, // ems
			y = text.attr("y"),
			x = text.attr("x"),
			dy = parseFloat(text.attr("dy")),
			tspan = text.text(null).append("tspan").attr("x", x).attr("y", y).attr("dy", dy + "em");
			
		while (word = words.pop()) {
		  line.push(word);
		  tspan.text(line.join(" "));
		  if (tspan.node().getComputedTextLength() > width) {
			line.pop();
			tspan.text(line.join(" "));
			line = [word];
			tspan = text.append("tspan").attr("x", x).attr("y", y).attr("dy", ++lineNumber * lineHeight + dy + "em").text(word);
		  }
		}
	  });}
}

var margin_radar_cv = {top: 70, right: 50, bottom: 50, left: 50},
				width_radar_cv = 350 - margin_radar_cv.left - margin_radar_cv.right,
				height_radar_cv = 350 - margin_radar_cv.top - margin_radar_cv.bottom - 20;
					
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////// Data ////////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

			var data = [
            [   
                {'axis': 'Build the data infrastructure', 'value': 0.3797757950125829},
				{'axis': 'Analyze data for business', 'value': 0.7345001143902997},
				{'axis': 'Build ML prototypes in new areas', 'value': 0.458361930908259},
                {'axis': 'Build ML services for products/workflows',
                'value': 0.31171356668954475},
                {'axis': 'Improving existing ML models', 'value': 0.3567833447723633},
                {'axis': 'Research to advance ML', 'value': 0.2675589110043468}
            ],
            [   
				{'axis': 'Build the data infrastructure', 'value': 0.388731396172927},
				{'axis': 'Analyze data for business', 'value': 0.6371367824238129},
                {'axis': 'Build ML prototypes in new areas', 'value': 0.5974486180014175},
                {'axis': 'Build ML services for products/workflows',
                'value': 0.4177888022678951},
                {'axis': 'Improving existing ML models', 'value': 0.49893692416725727},
                {'axis': 'Research to advance ML', 'value': 0.39936215450035434}
            ]
        ];
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
			//////////////////// Draw the Chart ////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

				
			var radarChartOptions = {
			  w: width_radar_cv,
			  h: height_radar_cv,
			  margin: margin_radar_cv,
			  maxValue: 0.8,
			  levels: 4,
			  roundStrokes: false,
			};
			//Call function to draw the Radar chart
			RadarChart(".radarChart_cv", data, radarChartOptions);

});

Roles in Computer Vision vs others

We see higher involvement of computer vision users in ML related activities as compared to its use in business intelligence. The main tasks will include:

  • Develop, test, and evaluate vision algorithms to control robots and other advanced hardware systems created for human interaction environments.
  • Implement and optimize analytics and machine learning algorithms using special purpose computing architectures.
  • Propose and implement creative, efficient solutions for vision and control problems.
  • Perform technical performance benchmarking and analyses to support engineering decisions.
  • Determine project specifications and project schedule, calculating time requirements and sequencing project elements.

As you can imagine this is an area where a good amount of knowledge is required. Like other roles related to machine learning, potential candidates will need to possess various skills including database management, as well as experience with component or object-oriented software, and fluency in C++, OpenCV, etc. Additionally, experience in 3D computer vision and video analytics algorithms, as well as machine learning algorithms for vision problems, including deep learning, is typically required.

4.2 Natural Language Processing
¶

Natural language processing(or NLP for short) is the branch of artificial intelligence which is concerned with the interaction between humans and machines through the use of natural language. It allows the machine to make sense of, and derive information that is of value from human language.

Source: Kaggle 2020 DS and ML Survey

js_t1 = '''
         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://d3js.org/d3.v4.min"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
        
         var margin_fields_nlp = {top: 40, right: 20, bottom: 40, left: 98},
            width_fields_nlp = 350 - margin_fields_nlp.left - margin_fields_nlp.right,
            height_fields_nlp = 340 - margin_fields_nlp.top - margin_fields_nlp.bottom;
        
        // append the svg_fields_nlp object to the body of the page
        var svg_fields_nlp = d3.select("#nlp_fields")
          .append("svg")
            .attr("width", width_fields_nlp + margin_fields_nlp.left + margin_fields_nlp.right)
            .attr("height", height_fields_nlp + margin_fields_nlp.top + margin_fields_nlp.bottom)
          .append("g")
            .attr("transform",
                  "translate(" + margin_fields_nlp.left + "," + margin_fields_nlp.top + ")");

        svg_fields_nlp.append("text")
            .text("Percentage of NLP users")
            .attr("x",0)
            .attr("y",-15)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "20px")

        // Parse the Data
        d3.csv("nlp_fields.csv", function(data) {
        
            var max = d3.max(data, d=> +d.value)
          // Add X axis
            var x = d3.scaleLinear()
                .domain([0, 35])
                .range([ 0, width_fields_nlp]);
            svg_fields_nlp.append("g")
                .attr("transform", "translate(0," + height_fields_nlp + ")")
                .call(d3.axisBottom(x))
                .selectAll("text")
                .style("text-anchor", "end");
        
            // Y axis
            var y = d3.scaleBand()
                .range([ 0, height_fields_nlp ])
                .domain(data.map(function(d) { return d.field; }))
                .padding(.1);
            svg_fields_nlp.append("g")
                .call(d3.axisLeft(y))
        
             //Bars
            svg_fields_nlp.selectAll("myRect")
                .data(data)
                .enter()
                .append("rect")
                .attr("x", x(0) )
                .attr("y", function(d) { return y(d.field); })
                .attr("width", function(d) { return x(d.value); })
                .attr("height", y.bandwidth() )
                .attr("fill", (d) => { return (+d.value == max? "#3f4d63": "#c6ccd8") })
        })

        var margin_tools_nlp = {top: 40, right: 20, bottom: 40, left: 20},
            width_tools_nlp = 350 - margin_tools_nlp.left - margin_tools_nlp.right,
            height_tools_nlp = 340 - margin_tools_nlp.top - margin_tools_nlp.bottom;

        var svg_tools_nlp = d3.select("#nlp_tools")
            .append("svg")
                .attr("width", width_tools_nlp + margin_tools_nlp.left + margin_tools_nlp.right)
                .attr("height", height_tools_nlp + margin_tools_nlp.top + margin_tools_nlp.bottom)
            .append("g")
                .attr("transform",
                    "translate(" + margin_tools_nlp.left + "," + margin_tools_nlp.top + ")");
        
        svg_tools_nlp.append("text")
            .text("Most used NLP Methods")
            .attr("x",10)
            .attr("y",-15)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "21px")            

        d3.csv("nlp_tools.csv", function(data) {

            data = data.sort((a,b) => d3.descending(+a.value, +b.value))
            var max = d3.max(data, d=> +d.value)
            // Add X axis
            var x = d3.scaleLinear()
                .domain([0, 1450])
                .range([ 0, width_tools_nlp]);
                svg_tools_nlp.append("g")
                    .attr("transform", "translate(0," + height_tools_nlp + ")")
                    .call(d3.axisBottom(x))
                    .selectAll("text")
                        .attr("transform", "translate(-10,0)")
                        .style("text-anchor", "end");


            // Y axis
            var y = d3.scaleBand()
            .range([ 0, height_tools_nlp ])
            .domain(data.map(function(d) { return d.name; }))
            .padding(.55);
            svg_tools_nlp.append("g")
            .call(d3.axisLeft(y))
                .selectAll("text")
                .attr("text-anchor", "start")
                .attr("transform", "translate(14,-16)")
                .style("font-family", "Tahoma")
                .style("font-size", "11px")

            // Bars
            svg_tools_nlp.selectAll("myRect")
            .data(data)
            .enter()
            .append("rect")
            .attr("x", x(0) )
            .attr("y", function(d) { return y(d.name); })
            .attr("width", function(d) { return x(d.value); })
            .attr("height", y.bandwidth() )
            .attr("fill", (d) => { return (+d.value == max? "#3f4d63": "#c6ccd8") })
            })

});

Document


From the above graphs we again see similar trends to what we observed in Computer vision - The bulk of our workforce is still data scientists, there is still a preference for working in smaller companies, and even the exact same countries were observed when looking at the top 10 employers.

Let's now look at the NLP specific behaviours:

  • Understanding Word Embeddings is part of building a strong foundation in NLP. Word embeddings is a means of representing words in such a manner that words similar in meaning have similar representations.
  • Transformer networks function similar to Recurrent Neural Networks in the sense that they are useful to handle sequential. A key difference that makes this useful in NLP is the fact that they don't require data to be processed in order(so the beginning of the sentence needn't always be processed before the end). This makes parellisation easier, resulting in reduced training times.
  • Encoder decoder models are used in sequence to sequence operations like text summarising, question answering. They utilise one encoding network to encode the input sequence and another decoding network to convert this into the desired target.
  • Contextualised word embeddings provide additional information in the embedding regarding the context in which it was used. eg. "ground" has different meanings in "ground coffee" and "training grounds" which is determined based on context.

What do they do?

            }
        </style>
    </head>
    <body>
        <div class="radarChart_nlp">

js_t1 = '''
         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/d3/3.5.5/d3.min.js"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
function RadarChart(id, data, options) {
	var cfg = {
	 w: 600,				//Width of the circle
	 h: 600,				//Height of the circle
	 margin: {top: 20, right: 20, bottom: 20, left: 20}, //The margins of the SVG
	 levels: 3,				//How many levels or inner circles should there be drawn
	 maxValue: 0, 			//What is the value that the biggest circle will represent
	 labelFactor: 1.26, 	//How much farther than the radius of the outer circle should the labels be placed
	 wrapWidth: 60, 		//The number of pixels after which a label needs to be given a new line
	 opacityArea: 0.35, 	//The opacity of the area of the blob
	 dotRadius: 3, 			//The size of the colored circles of each blog
	 opacityCircles: 0.1, 	//The opacity of the circles of each blob
	 strokeWidth: 1, 		//The width of the stroke around each blob
	 roundStrokes: false,	//If true the area and stroke will follow a round path (cardinal-closed)
	 color: d3.scaleOrdinal().range(["#bbb","#496595"])	//Color function
	};
	
	//Put all of the options into a variable called cfg
	if('undefined' !== typeof options){
	  for(var i in options){
		if('undefined' !== typeof options[i]){ cfg[i] = options[i]; }
	  }//for i
	}//if
	
	//If the supplied maxValue is smaller than the actual one, replace by the max in the data
	var maxValue = Math.max(cfg.maxValue, d3.max(data, function(i){return d3.max(i.map(function(o){return o.value;}))}));
		
	var allAxis = (data[0].map(function(i, j){return i.axis})),	//Names of each axis
		total = allAxis.length,					//The number of different axes
		radius = Math.min(cfg.w/2, cfg.h/2), 	//Radius of the outermost circle
		Format = d3.format('.0%'),			 	//Percentage formatting
		angleSlice = Math.PI * 2 / total;		//The width in radians of each "slice"
	
	//Scale for the radius
	var rScale = d3.scaleLinear()
		.range([0, radius])
		.domain([0, maxValue]);
		
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////////// Create the container SVG and g /////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

	//Remove whatever chart with the same id/class was present before
	d3.select(id).select("svg").remove();
	
	//Initiate the radar chart SVG
	var svg = d3.select(id).append("svg")
			.attr("width",  cfg.w + cfg.margin.left + cfg.margin.right)
			.attr("height", cfg.h + cfg.margin.top + cfg.margin.bottom)
			.attr("class", "radar"+id);
	//Append a g element		
	var g = svg.append("g")
			.attr("transform", "translate(" + (cfg.w/2 + cfg.margin.left) + "," + (cfg.h/2 + cfg.margin.top) + ")");
	
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	////////// Glow filter for some extra pizzazz ///////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Filter for the outside glow
	var filter = g.append('defs').append('filter').attr('id','glow'),
		feGaussianBlur = filter.append('feGaussianBlur').attr('stdDeviation','2.5').attr('result','coloredBlur'),
		feMerge = filter.append('feMerge'),
		feMergeNode_1 = feMerge.append('feMergeNode').attr('in','coloredBlur'),
		feMergeNode_2 = feMerge.append('feMergeNode').attr('in','SourceGraphic');

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	/////////////// Draw the Circular grid //////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Wrapper for the grid & axes
	var axisGrid = g.append("g").attr("class", "axisWrapper");
	
	//Draw the background circles
	axisGrid.selectAll(".levels")
	   .data(d3.range(1,(cfg.levels+1)).reverse())
	   .enter()
		.append("circle")
		.attr("class", "gridCircle")
		.attr("r", function(d, i){return radius/cfg.levels*d;})
		.style("fill", "#fff")
		.style("stroke", "#dedede")
		.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityCircles)
		.style("filter" , "url(#glow)");

	//Text indicating at what % each level is
	axisGrid.selectAll(".axisLabel")
	   .data(d3.range(1,(cfg.levels+1)).reverse())
	   .enter().append("text")
	   .attr("class", "axisLabel")
	   .attr("x", 4)
	   .attr("y", function(d){return -d*radius/cfg.levels;})
	   .attr("dy", "0.4em")
	   .style("font-size", "10px")
	   .attr("fill", "#737373")
	   .text(function(d,i) { return Format(maxValue * d/cfg.levels); });

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////////////////// Draw the axes //////////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Create the straight lines radiating outward from the center
	var axis = axisGrid.selectAll(".axis")
		.data(allAxis)
		.enter()
		.append("g")
		.attr("class", "axis");
	//Append the lines
	axis.append("line")
		.attr("x1", 0)
		.attr("y1", 0)
		.attr("x2", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue*1.05) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("y2", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue*1.05) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("class", "line")
		.style("stroke", "#333")
		.style("stroke-width", "1px");

	//Append the labels at each axis
	axis.append("text")
		.attr("class", "legend")
		.style("font-size", "10px")
		.attr("text-anchor", "middle")
		.attr("dy", "-1em")
		.attr("x", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue * cfg.labelFactor) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("y", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue * cfg.labelFactor) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
        .text(function(d){return d})
        .style("font-weight",600)
		.call(wrap, cfg.wrapWidth);

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	///////////// Draw the radar chart blobs ////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//The radial line function
	var radarLine = d3.lineRadial()
		.radius(function(d) { return rScale(d.value); })
		.angle(function(d,i) {	return i*angleSlice; })
        .curve(d3.curveLinearClosed);
		
	if(cfg.roundStrokes) {
		radarLine.interpolate("cardinal-closed");
	}
				
	//Create a wrapper for the blobs	
	var blobWrapper = g.selectAll(".radarWrapper")
		.data(data)
		.enter().append("g")
		.attr("class", "radarWrapper");
			
	//Append the backgrounds	
	blobWrapper
		.append("path")
		.attr("class", "radarArea")
		.attr("d", function(d,i) { return radarLine(d); })
		.style("fill", function(d,i) { return cfg.color(i); })
		.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityArea)
		.on('mouseover', function (d,i){
			//Dim all blobs
			d3.selectAll(".radarArea")
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", 0.1); 
			//Bring back the hovered over blob
			d3.select(this)
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", 0.7);	
		})
		.on('mouseout', function(){
			//Bring back all blobs
			d3.selectAll(".radarArea")
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityArea);
		});
		
	//Create the outlines	
	blobWrapper.append("path")
		.attr("class", "radarStroke")
		.attr("d", function(d,i) { return radarLine(d); })
		.style("stroke-width", cfg.strokeWidth + "px")
		.style("stroke", function(d,i) { return cfg.color(i); })
		.style("fill", "none")
		.style("filter" , "url(#glow)");		
	
	//Append the circles
	blobWrapper.selectAll(".radarCircle")
		.data(function(d,i) { return d; })
		.enter().append("circle")
		.attr("class", "radarCircle")
		.attr("r", cfg.dotRadius)
		.attr("cx", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("cy", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.style("fill", function(d,i,j) { return data[0].map((d)=>d.value).includes(d.value)? cfg.color(0): cfg.color(1); })
		.style("fill-opacity", 0.8);

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////// Append invisible circles for tooltip ///////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Wrapper for the invisible circles on top
	var blobCircleWrapper = g.selectAll(".radarCircleWrapper")
		.data(data)
		.enter().append("g")
		.attr("class", "radarCircleWrapper");
		
	//Append a set of invisible circles on top for the mouseover pop-up
	blobCircleWrapper.selectAll(".radarInvisibleCircle")
		.data(function(d,i) { return d; })
		.enter().append("circle")
		.attr("class", "radarInvisibleCircle")
		.attr("r", cfg.dotRadius*1.5)
		.attr("cx", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("cy", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.style("fill", "none")
		.style("pointer-events", "all")
		.on("mouseover", function(d,i) {
			newX =  parseFloat(d3.select(this).attr('cx')) - 10;
			newY =  parseFloat(d3.select(this).attr('cy')) - 10;
					
			tooltip
				.attr('x', newX)
				.attr('y', newY)
				.text(Format(d.value))
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style('opacity', 1);
		})
		.on("mouseout", function(){
			tooltip.transition().duration(200)
				.style("opacity", 0);
		});
		
	//Set up the small tooltip for when you hover over a circle
	var tooltip = g.append("text")
		.attr("class", "tooltip")
		.style("opacity", 0);
	
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	/////////////////// Helper Function /////////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

	//Taken from http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/7555321
	//Wraps SVG text	
	function wrap(text, width) {
	  text.each(function() {
		var text = d3.select(this),
			words = text.text().split(/\s+/).reverse(),
			word,
			line = [],
			lineNumber = 0,
			lineHeight = 1.4, // ems
			y = text.attr("y"),
			x = text.attr("x"),
			dy = parseFloat(text.attr("dy")),
			tspan = text.text(null).append("tspan").attr("x", x).attr("y", y).attr("dy", dy + "em");
			
		while (word = words.pop()) {
		  line.push(word);
		  tspan.text(line.join(" "));
		  if (tspan.node().getComputedTextLength() > width) {
			line.pop();
			tspan.text(line.join(" "));
			line = [word];
			tspan = text.append("tspan").attr("x", x).attr("y", y).attr("dy", ++lineNumber * lineHeight + dy + "em").text(word);
		  }
		}
	  });}
}

var margin_radar_nlp = {top: 70, right: 50, bottom: 50, left: 50},
				width_radar_nlp = 350 - margin_radar_nlp.left - margin_radar_nlp.right,
				height_radar_nlp = 350 - margin_radar_nlp.top - margin_radar_nlp.bottom - 20;
					
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////// Data ////////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

			var data = [
            [   
            {'axis': 'Build the data infrastructure', 'value': 0.3797757950125829},
            {'axis': 'Analyze data for business', 'value': 0.7345001143902997},
            {'axis': 'Build ML prototypes in new areas', 'value': 0.458361930908259},
            {'axis': 'Build ML services for products/workflows',
            'value': 0.31171356668954475},
            {'axis': 'Improving existing ML models', 'value': 0.3567833447723633},
            {'axis': 'Research to advance ML', 'value': 0.2675589110043468}
            ],
            [ //NLP data
             {'axis': 'Build the data infrastructure', 'value': 0.43927233814874267},
             {'axis': 'Analyze data for business decisions', 'value': 0.6773675762439807},
             {'axis': 'Build ML prototypes in new areas', 'value': 0.6260032102728732},
             {'axis': 'Build ML services for products/workflows',
              'value': 0.4724451578384163},
             {'axis': 'Improving existing ML models', 'value': 0.545211342964152},
             {'axis': 'Research to advance ML', 'value': 0.40823970037453183}]
            ];
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
			//////////////////// Draw the Chart ////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

				
			var radarChartOptions = {
			  w: width_radar_nlp,
			  h: height_radar_nlp,
			  margin: margin_radar_nlp,
			  maxValue: 0.8,
			  levels: 4,
			  roundStrokes: false,
			};
			//Call function to draw the Radar chart
			RadarChart(".radarChart_nlp", data, radarChartOptions);

});
'''

Roles in Natural Language
Processing vs others

While the most common role of data professionals is analysing data for business decisions, NLP users are lacking in this area. Likely, this is because they dont work with data analysis solely for business insights and instead focus their attention on the machine learning aspects of the job. This is evident by how their radar chart shows greater involvement in all ML related activities.

Is it challenging to learn NLP?¶

(from Stanford's popular CS224d: Natural Language Processing with Deep Learning course)

Natural language processing is a specialised area of machine learning with its own unique quirks and domain practices due to the nature of natural language(often text) data. One will see a lot of domain specific practices and techniques like tokenization, part-of-speech-tagging, stemming and lemmatization(breaking down works into their root component. eg. studying becomes study), stop word removal which are almost exclusively used with text data.

nlp_heatmap_df = pd.DataFrame()
for cosize in dataprofs["Q20"].unique():
    nlp_heatmap_df[cosize] = nlp_heatmap_data[cosize]

nlp_heatmap_df.columns = [col.split(" employees")[0] for col in nlp_heatmap_df.columns]

nlp_data_list = []
for cosize in nlp_heatmap_df.columns:
    for dssize in nlp_heatmap_df.index:
        nlp_data_list.append([cosize, dssize, nlp_heatmap_df[cosize].loc[dssize]])
        
nlp_data_df =  pd.DataFrame(nlp_data_list)

nlp_data_df.to_csv("nlp_heatmap.csv", index=False, header=["cosize","dssize","value"])

            .text("Data Science team size");  
                        
        // Labels of row and columns
        var myGroups = ['0-49', '50-249', '250-999', '1000-9,999', '10,000 or more']
        var myVars = ['0', '1-2', '3-4', '5-9', '10-14', '15-19', '20+']

        var y = d3.scaleBand()
        .range([ height_heatmap_nlp, 0 ])
        .domain(myVars)
        .padding(0.01);
        svg_heatmap_nlp.append("g")
        .call(d3.axisLeft(y));
        
        // Build color scale
        var myColor = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f7f7f7", "#29658c"]) //e9cf87
        .domain([1,300])

        d3.csv("nlp_heatmap.csv", function(data) {

            .data(data)
            .enter()
            .append("rect")
            .attr("x", function(d) { return x(d.cosize) })
            .attr("y", function(d) { return y(d.dssize) })
            .attr("width", x.bandwidth() )
            .attr("height", y.bandwidth() )
            .style("fill", function(d) { return myColor(d.value)} )

         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://d3js.org/d3.v4.min"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
        
         // set the dimensions and margins of the graph
        var margin_tree_nlp = {top: 20, right: 10, bottom: 5, left: 10},
            width_tree_nlp = 710 - margin_tree_nlp.left - margin_tree_nlp.right,
            height_tree_nlp = 340 - margin_tree_nlp.top - margin_tree_nlp.bottom;
        
        // append the svg object to the body of the page
        var svg_tree_nlp = d3.select("#nlp_tree")
        .append("svg")
            .attr("width", width_tree_nlp + margin_tree_nlp.left + margin_tree_nlp.right)
            .attr("height", height_tree_nlp + margin_tree_nlp.top + margin_tree_nlp.bottom)
        .append("g")
            .attr("transform", "translate(" + margin_tree_nlp.left + "," + margin_tree_nlp.top + ")");
        
        showData("count")
        document.getElementById("tree_button_nlp1").addEventListener("click", function(evt) {showData("count")});
        document.getElementById("tree_button_nlp2").addEventListener("click", function(evt) {showData("salary")});

        function showData(mode){
        // Read data
        d3.csv('nlp_tree.csv', function(data) {
        
        var max = d3.max(data, (d)=> {return mode =="count"?  +d.value: +d.value2;})
       
        var colorScale1 = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f1efd9","#AF9973","#a2885e"]) //["#a2885e","#f1efd9","#235f83"]
        .domain([40,max/6, max])

        var colorScale2 = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f1efd9","#457791","#235f83"]) //["#a2885e","#f1efd9","#235f83"]
        .domain([5000,max/2, max])

          // stratify the data: reformatting for d3.js
        var root = d3.stratify()
            .id(function(d) { return d.name; })   // Name of the entity (column name is name in csv)
            .parentId(function(d) { return d.parent; })   // Name of the parent (column name is parent in csv)
            (data);
        root.sum(function(d) {return mode =="count"?  +d.value: +d.value2; })   // Compute the numeric value for each entity
        
          // Then d3.treemap computes the position of each element of the hierarchy
          // The coordinates are added to the root object above
        d3.treemap()
            .size([width_tree_nlp, height_tree_nlp])
            .padding(4)
            (root)

        var u = svg_tree_nlp
            .selectAll("rect")
            .data(root.leaves())
            
            u
            .enter()
            .append("rect")
            .merge(u)
            .transition()
            .duration(700)
            .attr('x', function (d) { return d.x0; })
            .attr('y', function (d) { return d.y0; })
            .attr('width', function (d) { return d.x1 - d.x0; })
            .attr('height', function (d) { return d.y1 - d.y0; })
            .style("stroke", "black")
            .style("fill", (d) => {
                return (mode =="count"?  colorScale1(+d.value): colorScale2(+d.value))
            });
    
        

        // and to add the text labels
        var v = svg_tree_nlp
            .selectAll("text")
            .data(root.leaves())

            v
            .enter()
            .append("text")
            .merge(v)
                .attr("x", function(d){ return d.x0+10})    // +10 to adjust position (more right)
                .attr("y", function(d){ return d.y0+15})    // +20 to adjust position (lower)
                .text(function(d){ return d.data.name})
                .attr("font-size", "15px")
                .attr("fill", "white")
        
        var w = svg_tree_nlp
            .selectAll("text.count")
            .data(root.leaves())

            w
            .enter()
            .append("text")
            .merge(w)
                .attr("class", function(d){ return "count "+d.data.name})
                .attr("x", function(d){ return (d.x1+d.x0)/2 })    // +10 to adjust position (more right)
                .attr("y", function(d){ return (d.y1+d.y0)/2 + 15})    // +20 to adjust position (lower)
                .text(function(d){ return mode == "count"? d.data.value: (d.data.value2.replace(/\B(?=(\d{3})+(?!\d))/g, ","));})
                .attr("text-anchor","middle")
                .style("font-size", function(d){ 
                    return mode == "count"? "30px" : "22px";
                })
                .attr("fill", "white")
                .style("font-family", "Arial")
        
        svg_tree_nlp
            .append("text")
            .attr("class","title")
            .text("Salaries and Counts of Countries")
            .attr("x", 5)
            .attr("y",-5)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "21px")
        })
    }

});

For the first time we see Data Analyst ranked highly in the percentage of ml users across fields, this might mean that their focus is on predictive modelling and analytics, without the use of computer vision or NLP methods.

In countries we see how France and surprisingly China, have dropped off the top 10 list and are replaced by Spain and Nigeria. As the first African country to break the top 10 employers list, it shows that there is promise for machine learning and data science in Africa.

Let's take a look at some of the methods that might be worth knowing in this area.

  • Linear and Logistic regression: As everyone's starting point in machine learning, it's important to gain a good understanding of how linear models work which will act as a solid foundation even when working with more complex algorithms.
  • Decision Trees and Random Forests: Decision trees work by making a series of sequential decisions leading to a particular prediction. Random forests combine the outputs of several randomly generated trees which improves the overall performance on unseen data, as opposed to using a single decision tree.
  • Gradient Boosting machines(xgboost, lightGBM): While I wont go into the specifics of how each one works, in general gradient boosting involves building a predictive model using an ensemble on weaker prediction models.
  • Convolutional Neural Networks: CNNs are a class of deep neural networks that form the backbone of image processing in artificial intelligence. They are a great fit whenever the data has a natural 2D(or even 3D) structure.

What do they do?
¶

Source: Kaggle 2020 DS and ML Survey - Q23. Select any activities that make up an important part of your role at work.

js_t1 = '''
         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/d3/3.5.5/d3.min.js"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
function RadarChart(id, data, options) {
	var cfg = {
	 w: 600,				//Width of the circle
	 h: 600,				//Height of the circle
	 margin: {top: 20, right: 20, bottom: 20, left: 20}, //The margins of the SVG
	 levels: 3,				//How many levels or inner circles should there be drawn
	 maxValue: 0, 			//What is the value that the biggest circle will represent
	 labelFactor: 1.26, 	//How much farther than the radius of the outer circle should the labels be placed
	 wrapWidth: 60, 		//The number of pixels after which a label needs to be given a new line
	 opacityArea: 0.35, 	//The opacity of the area of the blob
	 dotRadius: 3, 			//The size of the colored circles of each blog
	 opacityCircles: 0.1, 	//The opacity of the circles of each blob
	 strokeWidth: 1, 		//The width of the stroke around each blob
	 roundStrokes: false,	//If true the area and stroke will follow a round path (cardinal-closed)
	 color: d3.scaleOrdinal().range(["#bbb","#496595"])	//Color function
	};
	
	//Put all of the options into a variable called cfg
	if('undefined' !== typeof options){
	  for(var i in options){
		if('undefined' !== typeof options[i]){ cfg[i] = options[i]; }
	  }//for i
	}//if
	
	//If the supplied maxValue is smaller than the actual one, replace by the max in the data
	var maxValue = Math.max(cfg.maxValue, d3.max(data, function(i){return d3.max(i.map(function(o){return o.value;}))}));
		
	var allAxis = (data[0].map(function(i, j){return i.axis})),	//Names of each axis
		total = allAxis.length,					//The number of different axes
		radius = Math.min(cfg.w/2, cfg.h/2), 	//Radius of the outermost circle
		Format = d3.format('.0%'),			 	//Percentage formatting
		angleSlice = Math.PI * 2 / total;		//The width in radians of each "slice"
	
	//Scale for the radius
	var rScale = d3.scaleLinear()
		.range([0, radius])
		.domain([0, maxValue]);
		
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////////// Create the container SVG and g /////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

	//Remove whatever chart with the same id/class was present before
	d3.select(id).select("svg").remove();
	
	//Initiate the radar chart SVG
	var svg = d3.select(id).append("svg")
			.attr("width",  cfg.w + cfg.margin.left + cfg.margin.right)
			.attr("height", cfg.h + cfg.margin.top + cfg.margin.bottom)
			.attr("class", "radar"+id);
	//Append a g element		
	var g = svg.append("g")
			.attr("transform", "translate(" + (cfg.w/2 + cfg.margin.left) + "," + (cfg.h/2 + cfg.margin.top) + ")");
	
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	////////// Glow filter for some extra pizzazz ///////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Filter for the outside glow
	var filter = g.append('defs').append('filter').attr('id','glow'),
		feGaussianBlur = filter.append('feGaussianBlur').attr('stdDeviation','2.5').attr('result','coloredBlur'),
		feMerge = filter.append('feMerge'),
		feMergeNode_1 = feMerge.append('feMergeNode').attr('in','coloredBlur'),
		feMergeNode_2 = feMerge.append('feMergeNode').attr('in','SourceGraphic');

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	/////////////// Draw the Circular grid //////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Wrapper for the grid & axes
	var axisGrid = g.append("g").attr("class", "axisWrapper");
	
	//Draw the background circles
	axisGrid.selectAll(".levels")
	   .data(d3.range(1,(cfg.levels+1)).reverse())
	   .enter()
		.append("circle")
		.attr("class", "gridCircle")
		.attr("r", function(d, i){return radius/cfg.levels*d;})
		.style("fill", "#fff")
		.style("stroke", "#dedede")
		.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityCircles)
		.style("filter" , "url(#glow)");

	//Text indicating at what % each level is
	axisGrid.selectAll(".axisLabel")
	   .data(d3.range(1,(cfg.levels+1)).reverse())
	   .enter().append("text")
	   .attr("class", "axisLabel")
	   .attr("x", 4)
	   .attr("y", function(d){return -d*radius/cfg.levels;})
	   .attr("dy", "0.4em")
	   .style("font-size", "10px")
	   .attr("fill", "#737373")
	   .text(function(d,i) { return Format(maxValue * d/cfg.levels); });

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////////////////// Draw the axes //////////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Create the straight lines radiating outward from the center
	var axis = axisGrid.selectAll(".axis")
		.data(allAxis)
		.enter()
		.append("g")
		.attr("class", "axis");
	//Append the lines
	axis.append("line")
		.attr("x1", 0)
		.attr("y1", 0)
		.attr("x2", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue*1.05) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("y2", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue*1.05) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("class", "line")
		.style("stroke", "#333")
		.style("stroke-width", "1px");

	//Append the labels at each axis
	axis.append("text")
		.attr("class", "legend")
		.style("font-size", "10px")
		.attr("text-anchor", "middle")
		.attr("dy", "-1em")
		.attr("x", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue * cfg.labelFactor) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("y", function(d, i){ return rScale(maxValue * cfg.labelFactor) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
        .text(function(d){return d})
        .style("font-weight",600)
		.call(wrap, cfg.wrapWidth);

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	///////////// Draw the radar chart blobs ////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//The radial line function
	var radarLine = d3.lineRadial()
		.radius(function(d) { return rScale(d.value); })
		.angle(function(d,i) {	return i*angleSlice; })
        .curve(d3.curveLinearClosed);
		
	if(cfg.roundStrokes) {
		radarLine.interpolate("cardinal-closed");
	}
				
	//Create a wrapper for the blobs	
	var blobWrapper = g.selectAll(".radarWrapper")
		.data(data)
		.enter().append("g")
		.attr("class", "radarWrapper");
			
	//Append the backgrounds	
	blobWrapper
		.append("path")
		.attr("class", "radarArea")
		.attr("d", function(d,i) { return radarLine(d); })
		.style("fill", function(d,i) { return cfg.color(i); })
		.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityArea)
		.on('mouseover', function (d,i){
			//Dim all blobs
			d3.selectAll(".radarArea")
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", 0.1); 
			//Bring back the hovered over blob
			d3.select(this)
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", 0.7);	
		})
		.on('mouseout', function(){
			//Bring back all blobs
			d3.selectAll(".radarArea")
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style("fill-opacity", cfg.opacityArea);
		});
		
	//Create the outlines	
	blobWrapper.append("path")
		.attr("class", "radarStroke")
		.attr("d", function(d,i) { return radarLine(d); })
		.style("stroke-width", cfg.strokeWidth + "px")
		.style("stroke", function(d,i) { return cfg.color(i); })
		.style("fill", "none")
		.style("filter" , "url(#glow)");		
	
	//Append the circles
	blobWrapper.selectAll(".radarCircle")
		.data(function(d,i) { return d; })
		.enter().append("circle")
		.attr("class", "radarCircle")
		.attr("r", cfg.dotRadius)
		.attr("cx", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("cy", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.style("fill", function(d,i,j) { return data[0].map((d)=>d.value).includes(d.value)? cfg.color(0): cfg.color(1); })
		.style("fill-opacity", 0.8);

	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	//////// Append invisible circles for tooltip ///////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	
	//Wrapper for the invisible circles on top
	var blobCircleWrapper = g.selectAll(".radarCircleWrapper")
		.data(data)
		.enter().append("g")
		.attr("class", "radarCircleWrapper");
		
	//Append a set of invisible circles on top for the mouseover pop-up
	blobCircleWrapper.selectAll(".radarInvisibleCircle")
		.data(function(d,i) { return d; })
		.enter().append("circle")
		.attr("class", "radarInvisibleCircle")
		.attr("r", cfg.dotRadius*1.5)
		.attr("cx", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.cos(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.attr("cy", function(d,i){ return rScale(d.value) * Math.sin(angleSlice*i - Math.PI/2); })
		.style("fill", "none")
		.style("pointer-events", "all")
		.on("mouseover", function(d,i) {
			newX =  parseFloat(d3.select(this).attr('cx')) - 10;
			newY =  parseFloat(d3.select(this).attr('cy')) - 10;
					
			tooltip
				.attr('x', newX)
				.attr('y', newY)
				.text(Format(d.value))
				.transition().duration(200)
				.style('opacity', 1);
		})
		.on("mouseout", function(){
			tooltip.transition().duration(200)
				.style("opacity", 0);
		});
		
	//Set up the small tooltip for when you hover over a circle
	var tooltip = g.append("text")
		.attr("class", "tooltip")
		.style("opacity", 0);
	
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
	/////////////////// Helper Function /////////////////////
	/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

	//Taken from http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/7555321
	//Wraps SVG text	
	function wrap(text, width) {
	  text.each(function() {
		var text = d3.select(this),
			words = text.text().split(/\s+/).reverse(),
			word,
			line = [],
			lineNumber = 0,
			lineHeight = 1.4, // ems
			y = text.attr("y"),
			x = text.attr("x"),
			dy = parseFloat(text.attr("dy")),
			tspan = text.text(null).append("tspan").attr("x", x).attr("y", y).attr("dy", dy + "em");
			
		while (word = words.pop()) {
		  line.push(word);
		  tspan.text(line.join(" "));
		  if (tspan.node().getComputedTextLength() > width) {
			line.pop();
			tspan.text(line.join(" "));
			line = [word];
			tspan = text.append("tspan").attr("x", x).attr("y", y).attr("dy", ++lineNumber * lineHeight + dy + "em").text(word);
		  }
		}
	  });}
}

var margin_radar_ml = {top: 70, right: 50, bottom: 50, left: 50},
				width_radar_ml = 350 - margin_radar_ml.left - margin_radar_ml.right,
				height_radar_ml = 350 - margin_radar_ml.top - margin_radar_ml.bottom - 20;
					
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////// Data ////////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

			var data = [
            [   
                {'axis': 'Build the data infrastructure', 'value': 0.3797757950125829},
				{'axis': 'Analyze data for business', 'value': 0.7345001143902997},
				{'axis': 'Build ML prototypes in new areas', 'value': 0.458361930908259},
                {'axis': 'Build ML services for products/workflows',
                'value': 0.31171356668954475},
                {'axis': 'Improving existing ML models', 'value': 0.3567833447723633},
                {'axis': 'Research to advance ML', 'value': 0.2675589110043468}
            ],
            [ // ML users             
             {'axis': 'Build the data infrastructure', 'value': 0.3849462365591398},
             {'axis': 'Analyze data for business decisions', 'value': 0.7206989247311828},
             {'axis': 'Build ML prototypes in new areas', 'value': 0.511021505376344},
             {'axis': 'Build ML services for products/workflows', 'value': 0.3467741935483871},
             {'axis': 'Improving existing ML models', 'value': 0.4028225806451613},
             {'axis': 'Research to advance ML', 'value': 0.2918010752688172}]
            ];
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 
			//////////////////// Draw the Chart ////////////////////////// 
			////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

				
			var radarChartOptions = {
			  w: width_radar_ml,
			  h: height_radar_ml,
			  margin: margin_radar_ml,
			  maxValue: 0.8,
			  levels: 4,
			  roundStrokes: false,
			};
			//Call function to draw the Radar chart
			RadarChart(".radarChart_ml", data, radarChartOptions);

});

js_t1 = '''
         require.config({
            paths: {
                d3: "https://d3js.org/d3.v4.min"
             }
             });
        require(["d3"], function(d3) {
        
         var margin_tree_ml = {top: 20, right: 10, bottom: 5, left: 10},
            width_tree_ml = 710 - margin_tree_ml.left - margin_tree_ml.right,
            height_tree_ml = 340 - margin_tree_ml.top - margin_tree_ml.bottom;
        
        // append the svg object to the body of the page
        var svg_tree_ml = d3.select("#ml_tree")
        .append("svg")
            .attr("width", width_tree_ml + margin_tree_ml.left + margin_tree_ml.right)
            .attr("height", height_tree_ml + margin_tree_ml.top + margin_tree_ml.bottom)
        .append("g")
            .attr("transform", "translate(" + margin_tree_ml.left + "," + margin_tree_ml.top + ")");
        
        showData("count")
        document.getElementById("tree_button_ml1").addEventListener("click", function(evt) {showData("count")});
        document.getElementById("tree_button_ml2").addEventListener("click", function(evt) {showData("salary")});

        function showData(mode){
        // Read data
        d3.csv('ml_tree.csv', function(data) {
        
        var max = d3.max(data, (d)=> {return mode =="count"?  +d.value: +d.value2;})
       
        var colorScale1 = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f1efd9","#AF9973","#a2885e"]) //["#a2885e","#f1efd9","#235f83"]
        .domain([40,max/6, max])

        var colorScale2 = d3.scaleLinear()
        .range(["#f1efd9","#457791","#235f83"]) //["#a2885e","#f1efd9","#235f83"]
        .domain([5000,max/2, max])

          // stratify the data: reformatting for d3.js
        var root = d3.stratify()
            .id(function(d) { return d.name; })   // Name of the entity (column name is name in csv)
            .parentId(function(d) { return d.parent; })   // Name of the parent (column name is parent in csv)
            (data);
        root.sum(function(d) {return mode =="count"?  +d.value: +d.value2; })   // Compute the numeric value for each entity
        
          // Then d3.treemap computes the position of each element of the hierarchy
          // The coordinates are added to the root object above
        d3.treemap()
            .size([width_tree_ml, height_tree_ml])
            .padding(4)
            (root)

        var u = svg_tree_ml
            .selectAll("rect")
            .data(root.leaves())
            
            u
            .enter()
            .append("rect")
            .merge(u)
            .transition()
            .duration(700)
            .attr('x', function (d) { return d.x0; })
            .attr('y', function (d) { return d.y0; })
            .attr('width', function (d) { return d.x1 - d.x0; })
            .attr('height', function (d) { return d.y1 - d.y0; })
            .style("stroke", "black")
            .style("fill", (d) => {
                return (mode =="count"?  colorScale1(+d.value): colorScale2(+d.value))
            });
    
        // and to add the text labels
        var v = svg_tree_ml
            .selectAll("text")
            .data(root.leaves())

            v
            .enter()
            .append("text")
            .merge(v)
                .attr("x", function(d){ return d.x0+10})    // +10 to adjust position (more right)
                .attr("y", function(d){ return d.y0+15})    // +20 to adjust position (lower)
                .text(function(d){ return d.data.name})
                .attr("font-size", "15px")
                .attr("fill", "white")
        
        var w = svg_tree_ml
            .selectAll("text.count")
            .data(root.leaves())

            w
            .enter()
            .append("text")
            .merge(w)
                .attr("class", function(d){ return "count "+d.data.name})
                .attr("x", function(d){ return (d.x1+d.x0)/2 })    // +10 to adjust position (more right)
                .attr("y", function(d){ return (d.y1+d.y0)/2 + 15})    // +20 to adjust position (lower)
                .text(function(d){ return mode == "count"? d.data.value: (d.data.value2.replace(/\B(?=(\d{3})+(?!\d))/g, ","));})
                .attr("text-anchor","middle")
                .style("font-size", function(d){ 
                    return mode == "count"? "30px" : "22px";
                })
                .attr("fill", "white")
                .style("font-family", "Arial")
        
        svg_tree_ml
            .append("text")
            .attr("class","title")
            .text("Salaries and Counts of Countries")
            .attr("x", 5)
            .attr("y",-5)
            .style("font-family", "Times New Roman")
            .style("font-size", "21px")
        })
    }


});
'''
